## Non-textbook problems

-   #1:  
    
    - (a) $X \sim \text{Binom}\bigg( \sum_{i=1}^m n_i, p \bigg)$
    
    - (b) $E(x) = p \cdot \sum_{i=1}^m n_i$
    
    - (c) $\text{Var}(X) = p \cdot (1-p) \cdot \sum_{i=1}^m n_i$


-   #2: 450


-   #3: Hint: use the definition of variance

-   #4: (a) $E(\overline{X}) = \mu$    (b) $\text{Var}(\overline{X}) = \dfrac{\sigma^2}{n}$
